title: Product Success Analyst
description:
Overview

At Essen Health Care, we care for that!

As the largest privately held multispecialty medical group in the Bronx, we provide high-quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a Population Health model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering urgent care, primary care, and specialty services, as well as nursing home staffing and care management. Founded in 1999, our over 20-year commitment has fueled an unwavering dedication toward innovating a better healthcare delivery system. Essen has expanded from a single primary care office to an umbrella organization offering specialties from women’s health to endocrinology, from psychiatry to a vast array of other specialties. All clinical services are offered via telehealth or in-person at over 35 medical offices and at home through the Essen House Calls program.

Essen Health Care is the place Where Care Comes Together! We are looking for the most talented and effective individuals to join our rapidly growing company. With over 1,100 employees and 400+ Practitioners, we care for over 250,000 patients annually in New York City and beyond. From medical providers to administration & operational staff, there is a career here for you. Join our team today!

Job Summary

We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Product Success Analyst with 3-5 years of experience in healthcare IT. This role is pivotal in ensuring the successful implementation, optimization, and long-term sustainability of our technology products. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with strong analytical skills, technical fluency, and the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives.

Responsibilities

- Lead and manage multiple concurrent product implementations within healthcare IT environments.- Conduct ROI analysis post-deployment to measure success and identify areas for optimization.- Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, operations, product, and executive leadership) to ensure product adaptability and alignment with business goals.- Develop and maintain a strategic product roadmap to guide long-term success and scalability.- Drive operational execution and support executive stakeholders in sustaining product rollouts.- Provide leadership and mentorship to team members; potential to build and manage a growing team.- Apply knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) to support product evolution and delivery.

Qualifications

- Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or a related field.

- 3-5 years of experience in healthcare IT, with a focus on product implementation and optimization.

- Strong understanding of technical product lifecycles and implementation methodologies.- Proficiency in:
- Excel, SQL, Python ? for data analysis and reporting.
- DevOps, Jira, Visio, Figma ? for project tracking, process mapping, and design collaboration.- Demonstrated experience in financial analysis and business case development.- Proven ability to lead teams, manage stakeholders, and influence decision-making.- Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

- Experience working with diverse teams and managing multiple implementations simultaneously.

- Familiarity with healthcare compliance standards and data privacy regulations is a plus.

Why Join Us?

- Opportunity to work on cutting-edge healthcare technology.- High-impact role with executive visibility and room for career growth.

- Collaborative and inclusive team culture.

- Potential to expand and lead a team under your direction

$55,000-$65,000

Equal Opportunity Employer

Essen Health care is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we seek candidates who desire to work in and serve an ethnically diverse population.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Web Analyst (Department of General Services, IT Division)
description:
The Rockland County Department of General Services, Information Technology Services Division is seeking a candidate to work on their Web Services team as a Web Analyst.

Technical work involving a responsibility for analyzing, developing, maintaining and providing support for the County’s internet and intranet websites and web applications. The work involves the development of web site content to ensure accuracy and performance of websites. The successful candidate will participate in the analysis, development, maintenance and support of the County’s internet and intranet websites and departmental pages; Consult directly with county departments to gather content and related requirements for webpages and/or web applications; Consult with vendors and consultants on web material and applications; Utilize web analytics to collect and analyze data on website traffic, and user interactions; Review information from departments to determine if current operational requirements are met; Develop, install, test and debug websites and web applications while ensuring accuracy and performance; Configure and monitor websites and web applications to ensure that they meet web accessibility standards and content is secure; Maintain, edit and update original website content; Provide training on website and web applications to departmental staff; Create graphic design elements and digital media for website and/or web applications; Stay current on new web industry trends, tools and technologies; May supervise technical staff involved in website or web applications; May research, evaluate and recommend website products, features, functions and troubleshooting.

The work is performed under the general supervision of a higher-level administrator and supervision may be provided to others. Does related work as required.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • A bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, Web Development, Graphic Technology, Graphic Design, Computer Graphics or comparable curriculum
  • Three (3) years of work experience in web design, web development, web analysis and/or web-based computer applications, one (1) year of which included directing the work of others and/or providing work guidance to staff.

Note: Graduation from high school or possession of an equivalency diploma plus additional years of the required work experience may be substituted for the college degree on a year-for-year basis.

Salary and Benefits:

  • $79,310 Annual Salary
  • 40 Hour work week
  • Medical, Dental and Vision
  • Time off including vacation, personal and holiday time
  • New York State Pension eligibility
  • Other benefits, including, but not limited to deferred compensation, tuition reimbursement, leadership and other professional development training

How to Apply:

Interested candidates should submit a completed Rockland County employment application, resume, cover letter and references at https://rcklnd.us/its-application
Click here to access the online application.

Position open until filled.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $79,310.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Flexible schedule
  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Retirement plan
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Analyst - Risk Management
description:
At American Express, our culture is built on a 175-year history of innovation, shared values and Leadership Behaviors, and an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities, and colleagues. As part of Team Amex, you'll experience this powerful backing with comprehensive support for your holistic well-being and many opportunities to learn new skills, develop as a leader, and grow your career.

Here, your voice and ideas matter, your work makes an impact, and together, you will help us define the future of American Express.

How will you make an impact in this role?

Senior Analyst-Risk Management

  • Positions in Credit & Fraud Risk lead the development of credit, operational, enterprise, and fraud policies designed to profitably grow the portfolio while ensuring an excellent customer experience. These policies utilize mathematical models and other techniques to understand and predict customer behavior.

  • The Customer Management function is responsible for building risk strategies for Line Suspension and Closure, Credit Line Decrease and Rightsizing, and Proactive Financial Gathering for the Blueprint Business Line of Credit (BLOC) portfolio. The team works closely with partners in Product, Operations, Technology, Data Science and other Risk teams to implement, manage, and improve the outcomes of the aforementioned strategies. There is a strong focus on driving synergies between the Customer Management functions across the BLOC and the Card business to effectively control credit losses and ensure consistency in actions across the affiliate companies.


    In this role, you can expect to:


  • Gather, transform, and analyze data to draw conclusions and make business decisions

  • Define a roadmap for, drive critical initiatives on, and enhance strategies for BLOC Responsible Lending Actions to reduce losses on the portfolio

  • Develop systems and processes for effective risk assessment of businesses through proactive gathering of financials & re-underwriting

  • Monitor portfolio performance and conduct deep dives into delinquent accounts to identify improvement opportunities across the product lifecycle

  • Work closely with partners across various business units to implement changes on risk strategies


    Qualifications:

  • Education: a bachelor's or master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance/Economics or a related quantitative field is required; a master's degree is a plus

  • Experience: 2+ years of credit-related analytics experience, preferably in a risk management context

  • Relevant Knowledge: understanding of US consumer or commercial lending and credit risk management practices; experience with business loans, personal loans, mortgage lending, or credit cards is a plus; understanding of statistical concepts is a plus

  • Technical Skills: SQL is required; experience with spreadsheet and data analysis tools (preferably Microsoft Excel) is required; Python, R, or another language suited towards data analysis is a plus; experience with PowerBI is a plus

  • Soft Skills: ability to think logically, critically, and constructively about complex problems; clearly communicate findings; and propose solutions that address expressed needs. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for interaction with internal and external teams

Salary Range: $78,000.00 to $124,750.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

We back you with benefits that support your holistic well-being so you can be and deliver your best. This means caring for you and your loved ones' physical, financial, and mental health, as well as providing the flexibility you need to thrive personally and professionally:

  • Competitive base salaries
  • Bonus incentives
  • 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
  • Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
  • Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
  • 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
  • Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
  • Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
  • Career development and training opportunities

For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law. American Express will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with arrest or conviction records, in accordance with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including, but not limited to, the California Fair Chance Act, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. For positions covered by federal and/or state banking regulations, American Express will comply with such regulations as it relates to the consideration of applicants with criminal convictions.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
NYU Grossman School of Medicine is one of the nation's top-ranked medical schools. For 175 years, NYU Grossman School of Medicine has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history and enrich the lives of countless people. An integral part of NYU Langone Health, the Grossman School of Medicine at its core is committed to improving the human condition through medical education, scientific research, and direct patient care. At NYU Langone Health, equity and inclusion are fundamental values. We strive to be a place where our exceptionally talented faculty, staff, and students of all identities can thrive. We embrace inclusion and individual skills, ideas, and knowledge.

For more information, go to med.nyu.edu, and interact with us on LinkedIn, Glassdoor, Indeed, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

Position Summary:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Senior Data Analyst.

Dr. Sunita Desais' lab is seeking a qualified Senior Data Analyst with strong data management and programming skills, particularly in the use of large scale CMS administrative claims data and other large health care sets and the use of quasi-experimental research methods. Our teams work applies quantitative causal inference methods to large health care databases including health care claims, electronic health records, and all-payer discharge data to answer health policy/economics research questions. Research projects address issues related to health care pricing, hospital markets, and the impacts of policies on health care spending and outcomes. The new team member will be responsible for data wrangling, analytic data set construction, and data analysis to support these projects and will ideally become involved and influential in decisions about the direction of the research and analysis. Through this work, analysts will gain skills and knowledge in the practical implementation of causal inference, data analysis, health care policies and payment systems, recent issues/trends in health care policy and the delivery system. This role will work closely with Dr. Desai and other lab members to work on several federally funded initiatives. The individual in this position will support multiple projects in day-to-day activities which include data collection, preliminary data analysis, data visualization, and results dissemination. The successful candidate will have a high degree of professional maturity, commitment to excellence, independence, flexibility, and initiative, and will possess the ability to work collaboratively with diverse individuals, teams, and populations both internally and externally.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Wrangle, clean, and maintain data from large administrative claims data sets and other sources in support of research protocols and projects.
  • Create secondary data sets from databases to support new and ongoing research.
  • Perform reviews to ensure accuracy and completeness of data.
  • Provide technical assistance and support to stakeholders to help them use data resources effectively and creatively.
  • Under supervision of research faculty, conduct statistical analyses and present them to the team and collaborators.
  • Support creation of tables and other data visualizations.
  • Participate in project meetings and workgroups to share knowledge and best practices
  • Produce publication ready tables and data visualizations
  • Think independently to identify data oddities, conceive of creative data visualizations, and suggest logical next steps
  • Contribute to team research project meetings
  • Performs other duties as assigned
Minimum Qualifications:
To qualify you must have a degree in economics, epidemiology, data science, biostatistics, health policy, or a related field
  • an interest in health policy/economics research and quantitative methods
  • experience with advanced regression methods and causal inference methods (differences-in-differences, regression discontinuity, etc.)
  • comfort with handling large, relational data sets and working on servers
  • highly proficient in R
  • Ability to perform fuzzy merges of complex data sets
  • Self-motivated and proactive with excellent organizational and communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with administrative claims data and exposure to quasi-experimental econometric methods
Action-oriented and eager to embrace new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Strong organizational, prioritization, and time management skills
Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.

title: Business Analyst - Capital markets
description:
OVERVIEW
We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst with a strong background in Capital Markets to support the delivery of large-scale business and technology initiatives. This role involves conducting competitive analysis, monitoring product and system performance, and assessing issues to develop effective solutions. The Product Manager is responsible for P&L, managing product risks, and ensuring the successful delivery of product features aligned with strategic goals.
Pay Rate: $84 on W2
Duration: 6 months with possibility to conversion
Not C2C eligible
Location: NY
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Develop and communicate the product vision and roadmap, ensuring alignment with Agile Teams and stakeholders. Collaborate with Solution Architects/Engineering to define and maintain Nonfunctional Requirements (NFRs) and system quality standards.
  • Manage and prioritize the product backlog, ensuring a continuous flow of well-defined features and user stories ready for development.
  • Participate in quarterly planning sessions by presenting the product vision, proposed features, and upcoming milestones.
  • Define release plans and program increments, including new features, architectural considerations, and technical debt management.
  • Collaborate with Solution Architects/Engineering to understand and sequence enabler work, supporting the development of the Architectural Runway for new business functionalities.
  • Explain financial results, forecast future performance, and identify opportunities to improve profitability through data-driven insights.
  • Manage product risks and contribute to the evolution of policies, procedures, and controls to support product success.
QUALIFICATIONS
  • 3+ years of retail product management experience, preferably within the financial services industry.
  • Advanced proficiency in Excel, including functions and macros.
  • Strong analytical skills, with experience in PowerBI and SQL preferred.
  • Expertise in product design, business case development, pricing strategies, campaign management, technology project delivery, P&L management, and risk mitigation.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other non-merit factor. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About the Role

A leading real estate investment firm specializing in infrastructure assets is seeking a Data Analyst to join its Acquisitions team in New York City. This is an excellent opportunity for a data-driven individual who’s eager to start a career in real estate, commercial real estate, or investment firms.

In this role, you’ll be responsible for researching and identifying qualified, accurate ownership data for telecom and infrastructure lease assets across the U.S. You’ll work closely with the Acquisitions and Marketing teams to ensure that outreach efforts are backed by precise, high-quality data — directly contributing to the company’s growth.

This is a hands-on, fast-paced position that offers exposure to the business side of real estate investing and acquisitions, ideal for someone who enjoys research, problem-solving, and turning data into actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities

• Research and compile accurate property and ownership information for telecom and infrastructure lease assets nationwide
• Identify and qualify high-quality leads to support the Acquisitions team’s prospecting and outreach efforts
• Analyze large datasets to verify accuracy, detect patterns, and improve lead quality
• Maintain and update internal databases and CRM systems with current and reliable information
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance data collection, reporting, and lead generation processes
• Use Excel and other data tools to organize, clean, and analyze datasets efficiently

Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Business, Economics, Real Estate, or a related field
• 0–2 years of experience in data research, analytics, or a related role (internships welcome)
• Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel; familiarity with CRM or database systems preferred
• Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy
• Ability to work quickly and efficiently in a fast-paced, high-volume environment
• Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills
• Interest in real estate, commercial real estate, or investment firms

title: Lead Analyst
description:
About us

National Grid is hiring for a Lead Data Analyst for our NY Electric Integrated Planning & Portfolio Management Department. This position can be based in Syracuse, NY .

Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.

To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.

Job Purpose

The Lead Data Analyst will primarily be responsible for providing support to the Electric Capital Portfolio through the development of strategic initiatives and coordinating with stakeholders to execute annual plans as well as actively managing and reporting against the plan.

Key Accountabilities

  • Execute and support the NY Electric Capital Portfolio plan and monthly calibration processes.
  • Assist with regulatory and financial reporting, including QRF submissions, variance reporting, annual business planning, and CIP filings.
  • Ensure data accuracy across various systems such as Powerplan, STORMS, Future Now, and SAP by collaborating with stakeholders.
  • Partner with Project Management, Program Management, Project Development, and Transmission and Distribution Asset Management to align project forecasts with budgetary targets.
  • Develop and support department KPIs that align with strategic priorities to enhance performance tracking.
  • Analyze data to identify operational trends and improvement opportunities.
  • Facilitate information sharing and learning within Work Development and Resource Management.
  • Provide analytic reporting and process development for internal strategic improvement initiatives.
  • Ensure alignment between current processes and reporting/system capabilities.
  • Coach and upskill analysts in tool design and development.
  • Implement processes and products for annual planning and ongoing portfolio management.
  • Conduct financial and resource reporting, including ad hoc requests for variance analysis and CAPEX/OPEX savings initiatives.
  • Perform administrative tasks to support Future-Now and capital planning initiatives.
  • Train and develop new team members on processes, products, and legacy systems.

Qualifications

  • Over 7 years of experience in financial reporting or equivalent relevant experience.
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or accounting; MBA preferred.
  • Proven experience in developing and implementing budgeting, forecasting, and reporting processes.
  • Familiarity with SAP, Powerplan, STORMS, Primavera, and Business Intelligence Reporting.
  • Proficient in Excel; Power BI skills are a plus.
  • Strong ability to prioritize work and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.
  • Effective communicator, able to articulate decisions and their rationale to affected parties.
  • Capable of providing guidance and managing responsibilities at a senior management level.
  • Organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple projects and make independent decisions confidently.
  • Understanding of electric business operations or a strong desire to learn.
  • Skilled in interpreting information and analyzing complex problems to articulate findings and anticipate obstacles.
  • Ability to build strong relationships with key stakeholders.
  • Knowledgeable about policies and processes, with the ability to challenge and improve existing practices.
  • Experience in successfully delivering complex projects and possessing team leadership skills.
  • Strong influencing and negotiating abilities.
  • High level of personal initiative and ability to collaborate positively with company personnel, contractors, regulatory representatives, and officials.
  • Knowledge of power system operations, electrical and civil engineering, environmental engineering economics, and utility accounting regulations.
  • Ability to manage projects under budget and time constraints, with a focus on metrics and continuous improvement.
  • Strong skills in negotiations, presentations, construction management, interpersonal and written communication, and critical analysis.
  • High personal standards of commitment and integrity.
  • Valid driver’s license required.

More Information

Salary: $108,000.00 - $127,000.00 USD


This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience, expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience.

National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.

title: Workday Business Analyst (Onsite)
description: • 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or Functional Lead with hands-on Workday experience. • Proven track record in Workday deployment or large-scale system implementation (HCM, Payroll, Finance, or Time & Absence preferred). • Demonstrated experience managing complex, multi-department technology projects. • Strong understanding of HR, Finance, and IT business processes. • Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage executive stakeholders and end users. • Ability to influence decisions, drive accountability, and guide project teams.

title: Business Analyst/Senior Business Analyst
description:
Business Analyst/Senior Business Analyst

Business Analyst

Required Qualifications (as evidenced by an attached resume):
Bachelor’s degree (foreign equivalent or higher). Three (3) years of full-time experience in a business analysis, financial analysis, project management, or a similar role. Demonstrated experience with requirements analysis/management tools (i.e. Smartsheet, ServiceNow, Jira). Experience with Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Workspace. Proficiency with business systems such as Financials, Human Resources, and Planning.

Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced degree (foreign equivalent or higher). Five (5) or more years of full-time experience working in a business analysis, project management or a similar role. Experience in a customer facing role within a financial, HR or similar department. Experience in Higher Education. Experience with business requirements in an ERP system (Oracle, etc.).

Brief Description of Duties:
The incumbent will aid in the Oracle ERP implementation and ongoing support for the application(s). The Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting enterprise systems and implementing data-driven solutions. This role involves gaining an understanding of system configurations, business analysis, and project management. The incumbent must have good communication skills, the ability to understand and interpret business needs, as well as analytical and problem-solving abilities.


  • Documentation & Communications:
    • Assist with the development and maintenance of business process guides (BPGs).
    • Collaborate with MarCom, Change Management, and other groups to ensure ongoing communication with the campus community regarding functionality, enhancements, and updates.
    • Assist with the maintenance of Oracle configuration workbooks for the specified product/module.
    • Support the continuous development and maintenance of the WolfieONE user documentation, including website content, quick reference guides, QA documentation, business processes, and policies/procedures.
  • Requirements Gathering and Business Analysis:
    • Collaborate with business stakeholders to elicit, document, and analyze both functional and non-functional requirements.
    • Maintain use cases, process flows, and documentation to clearly communicate business requirements.
    • Collaborate with technical teams to design solutions that align with business needs and objectives.
    • Once solutions are designed, analyze and document the configurations of the modules/systems.
    • Facilitate testing and validation processes to ensure system changes meet requirements and are thoroughly tested before implementation.
    • Assist in continuous implementation and improvement efforts.
  • Systems Support, Quarterly Updates:
    • Review Oracle release notes to assess their impact on the current system and configurations.
    • Make recommendations for adopting new functionality and provide an impact summary to senior business analysts and senior management.
    • Contribute to both short-term and long-term solutions for functionality, including troubleshooting, conducting in-depth sessions with SMEs, and coordinate patches and workarounds.
    • Support in the creation of detailed project plans for individual releases or enhancements, covering deployment, testing, meetings, communications ,and documentation requirements (training materials, config workbooks, stakeholder approvals).
    • Address helpdesk tickets, service requests (SRs), enhancement requests, and other system support or maintenance workflows.
    • Provide direct user support to functional owners, SMEs, and end users. Assist in updating training materials, supporting training sessions, informing communications, and sustainment/maintenance documentation.
  • Project Planning and Analysis:
    • Support project plans, timelines, and deliverables for the specific workstream.
    • Collaborate with sustainment team members to review, prioritize, and schedule enhancement requests from various users.
    • Assist with the creation, management, and validation of reporting requirements, ensuring alignment with the data governance strategy is followed.
    • Test enhancements, system improvements, and defect/bug patches to ensure no loss of functionality.
    • Assist in coordinating resources and project progress, ensuring stakeholder expectations are met.
  • Professional Development:
    • Stay up to date on Oracle functionality and product roadmaps through professional development opportunities, including Oracle training and certifications, professional conferences, and higher education forums/user groups.
  • Additional Duties & Responsibilities as Assigned:
    • Perform other duties or projects as assigned, in line with rank and departmental mission.


Senior Business Analyst

Required Qualifications (as evidenced by an attached resume):
Bachelor’s degree (foreign equivalent) or higher. Five (5) years of full-time experience in a business analysis, financial analysis, project management or a similar role. Demonstrated experience with requirements analysis/management tools (i.e. Smartsheet, ServiceNow, Jira). Experience with Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Workspace. Proficiency with business systems, such as Financials, Human Resources, and Planning.

Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced degree (foreign equivalent or higher). Seven (7) or more years of full-time experience working in a business analysis, project management, or a similar role. Experience in a customer-facing role within a financial, HR or similar department. Experience in Higher Education. Experience with business requirements in an ERP system (Oracle, etc.).

Brief Description of Duties:
The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting enterprise systems and leading the implementation of data-driven solutions. This role involves a critical focus on configurations, business analysis, and project management. This position will play a key role in the Oracle ERP implementation and ongoing support of enterprise systems, and in implementing data-driven solutions. The incumbent must have excellent communication skills, proven ability to understand and interpret business needs, as well as strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

  • Requirements Gathering and Business Analysis:
    • Lead conversations with business stakeholders to elicit, document, and analyze both functional and non-functional requirements.
    • Develop and manage use cases, process flows, and documentation to clearly communicate business requirements.
    • Collaborate with technical teams to design solutions that align with business needs and objectives.
    • Once solutions are designed, analyze and document the configurations of the modules/systems.
    • Lead testing and validation processes to ensure system changes meet requirements and are thoroughly tested before implementation, while also finding opportunities to implement and build automated testing options.
    • Drive continuous implementation and improvement efforts.
  • Systems Support, Quarterly Updates:
    • Review Oracle release notes to assess their impact on the current system and configurations. Prioritize recommendations for adopting new functionality and provide an impact summary to senior management.
    • Develop both short-term and long-term solutions for functionality, including troubleshooting, conducting in-depth sessions with SMEs, and coordinating patches and workarounds. Lead/Co-lead efforts to create detailed project plans for individual releases or enhancements, covering deployment, testing, meetings, communications, and documentation requirements (training materials, config workbooks, stakeholder approvals).
    • Manage and distribute helpdesk tickets, service requests (SRs), enhancement requests, and other system support or maintenance workflows.
    • Guide business analysts and junior business analysts in directing user support to functional owners, SMEs, and end users.
    • Ensure timely updates to training materials, support training sessions, and the development of communications and sustainment/maintenance documentation.
  • Documentation & Communications:
    • Develop and maintain business process guides (BPGs). Collaborate with MarCom, Change Management, and other groups to ensure ongoing communication with the campus community regarding functionality, enhancements, and updates.
    • Create and maintain Oracle configuration workbooks for specified products/modules. Responsible for consolidation of workbooks by workstream (HR, Finance, etc.).
    • Support the continuous development and maintenance of the WolfieONE user documentation, including website content, quick reference guides, QA documentation, business processes and policies/procedures.
  • Project Planning and Analysis:
    • Inform & support project plans, timelines, and deliverables for specific workstream.
    • Collaborate with sustainment team members to review, prioritize and schedule enhancement requests from various users.
    • Create, manage and validate reporting requirements, ensuring alignment with data governance strategies.
    • Lead test enhancements, system improvements and defects/bug patches to ensure no loss of functionality.
    • Partner with the project manager to coordinate resources and project progress, ensuring stakeholder expectations are met.
  • Professional Development:
    • Stay up to date on Oracle functionality and product roadmaps through professional development opportunities, including Oracle training and certifications, professional conferences and higher education forums/user groups. Assist sustainment leadership in expanding professional development opportunities for Oracle and WolfieONE.
  • Additional Duties & Responsibilities as Assigned:
    • Perform other duties or projects as assigned, in line with rank and departmental mission.


Special Notes:
This is a full-time appointment. FLSA Exempt position, not eligible for the overtime provisions of the FLSA. Minimum salary threshold must be met to maintain FLSA exemption.

In addition to the employee's base salary, this position is eligible for $4,000 UUP annual location pay, paid biweekly.

For this position, we are unable to sponsor candidates for work visas.

title: Privacy Program Data Analyst
description:
Job Title: Privacy Program Data Analyst

Company: NorthEast Provider Solutions Inc.

City/State: Valhalla, NY

Category: Clerical/Administrative Support

Department: Compliance- WMC Health

Union: No

Position: Full Time

Hours: M-F

Shift: Day

Req #: 45472

Posted Date: Nov 07, 2025

Hiring Range: $65,907 - $82,846


Job Details:

Job Summary:

The Privacy Program Data Analyst supports the WMC Health Network’s privacy program by analyzing privacy-related data, assisting in risk assessments, and ensuring compliance with HIPAA and other privacy regulations. Reporting to the Director of Privacy Program, this role helps monitor privacy incidents, track trends in privacy risks, support privacy investigations, and assist in maintaining privacy policies and training programs. The Privacy Analyst collaborates with various departments to promote privacy awareness and protect patient information across the network.

Responsibilities:

  • Monitor and analyze privacy incidents and potential breaches, documenting findings and supporting investigations.
  • Track and analyze trends in privacy incidents and risks to proactively identify areas requiring attention.
  • Conduct privacy risk assessments and assist in identifying vulnerabilities within the network’s privacy program.
  • Support the development, review, and maintenance of privacy policies, procedures, and related documentation.
  • Help prepare and deliver privacy training materials and educational programs for staff across the network.
  • Manage and maintain accurate records and reports on privacy activities, compliance metrics, and regulatory requirements.
  • Collaborate with clinical, IT, legal, and compliance teams to ensure coordinated privacy efforts and regulatory adherence.
  • Support internal and external privacy audits by providing data analysis and required documentation.
  • Stay current with changes in privacy laws, regulations, and best practices to ensure ongoing compliance.
  • Assist the Director of Privacy Program in various projects and initiatives aimed at enhancing the privacy program’s effectiveness.
  • Monitor trends and patterns in privacy data to proactively identify potential risks or areas requiring further investigation.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications/Requirements:

Experience:

  • 1 year of experience in data analysis, privacy or regulatory management in a large healthcare facility, required

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Healthcare Administration, or a related field, required.
  • Master’s degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Healthcare Administration, or a related field, preferred.

Licenses / Certifications:

  • Certified in Healthcare Privacy Compliance (CHPC) preferred.

Other:

  • Confidentiality: It is an expectation that all employees at Westchester Medical Center Health Network will protect the confidentiality of all patient care, personnel, and business/financial information.
  • Compliance: Employees will complete required competencies, annual mandatory training requirements and adhere to the code of conduct as described in the Westchester Medical Center Health Network Compliance Plan and brochure.
  • Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.
Special Requirements:
  • Knowledgeable in HIPAA, and Federal and State regulations for hospitals & physician practices.
  • Planning and conducting effective, confidential investigations.

About Us:

NorthEast Provider Solutions Inc.

Benefits:

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package that includes:

  • Health Insurance
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • Retirement Savings Plan
  • Flexible Savings Account
  • Paid Time Off
  • Holidays
  • Tuition Reimbursement
company_description: Westchester Medical Center Health Network, WMCHealth, is an anchor institution with a strong history of providing care to the Hudson Valley

title: Senior Analyst-Enterprise Risk Management and Change Governance
description:
At American Express, our culture is built on a 175-year history of innovation, shared values and Leadership Behaviors, and an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities, and colleagues. As part of Team Amex, you'll experience this powerful backing with comprehensive support for your holistic well-being and many opportunities to learn new skills, develop as a leader, and grow your career.

Here, your voice and ideas matter, your work makes an impact, and together, you will help us define the future of American Express.

The U.S. Consumer Services Team is responsible for our suite of consumer products, services, and experiences in the U.S., including our premium, cobrand, cash back, and lending portfolios, Membership Rewards, Global Travel & Lifestyle Services, the Centurion Lounge network, our Global Dining and Resy businesses, U.S. Consumer Banking, and best-in-class marketing programs across customer, prospect, and partner channels. The USCS team is focused on making membership an indisputable competitive advantage and helping each other become better leaders every day.

The objective of the US Consumer Governance and Change team is to establish the Operational Risk and Governance strategy for US Consumer, setting up a foundational governance structure that ensures operational risks are identified, assessed, and managed in compliance with enterprise Operational Risk Management programs and reporting.


The Sr. Analyst will help drive business unit–level risk management practices that align with enterprise strategy and governance. This role will support the development of a business unit risk appetite framework, support risk identification and assessment processes, and support internal and external exam fieldwork.


The Sr. Analyst, US Consumer Governance and Change will also play a key role in leading policy management and maintenance for USCS. This includes becoming the primary source of knowledge on all USCS policy updates, overseeing policy governance activities, and ensuring alignment with Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) standards. The Sr. Analyst will partner closely with Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) teams to ensure USCS policy governance remains compliant, consistent, and transparent across the organization.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Lead policy management for USCS Governance, staying up to date on all emerging changes, and effectively communicating with key USCS stakeholders.


  • Serve as a subject matter expert and liaison with Enterprise Risk Management (ERM), maintaining strong collaboration to align on governance, reporting, and regulatory standards.


  • Integrate enterprise risk management framework across USCS through regular communication


  • Track specific issues with KRI limits and risk appetite for US Consumer Services to ensure operational risks are managed within agreed thresholds.

  • Help develop BU-specific procedures and standards (e.g., escalation protocols) related to the execution of the Operational Risk Management programs.

    • Support internal and external exam management processes, working with Enterprise functions (e.g., data request compilation, action implementation, and regulatory adherence).

    • Assist in implementing portions of the operational risk framework to enable effective risk management and decision-making in the BU.

  • Support execution plans for operational risk management within the business unit (BU), including BU-specific guidelines and project plans


Required Qualifications:

  • 2+ Years experience in
    operational risk management (e.g., within Risk and/or Internal Audit function) Understanding of critical operational risk management lifecycle activities

  • Project management,
    communication, and interpersonal skills

  • Experience in process governance, with an understanding of
    processes that align with policies, regulatory frameworks, and/or operational standards

  • Sound analytical and problem-solving skills, with an ability to analyze data, identify trends, and evaluate risk scenarios effectively

  • Strong skills with Microsoft Office products including Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelors Degree in Finance Business, Risk Mgmt., or related field; advanced degrees (e.g., MBA, MSc) or certifications are advantageous

  • Preferred: Experience in Enterprise Risk Management and/or policy management and governance.

  • Experience in at least one of the following:

  • Translating operational risk strategy and appetite into execution guidelines

  • Tracking and identifying issues with Key Risk Indicator (KRI) limits and risk appetite to ensure operational risks are managed within agreed thresholds

  • Facilitating the implementation of the operational risk governance frameworks

  • Developing, communicating and ensuring understanding and adherence to operational risk procedures and standards

  • Supporting the operational risk exam management processes

Salary Range: $78,000.00 to $124,750.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

We back you with benefits that support your holistic well-being so you can be and deliver your best. This means caring for you and your loved ones' physical, financial, and mental health, as well as providing the flexibility you need to thrive personally and professionally:

  • Competitive base salaries
  • Bonus incentives
  • 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
  • Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
  • Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
  • 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
  • Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
  • Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
  • Career development and training opportunities

For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site .

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law. American Express will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with arrest or conviction records, in accordance with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including, but not limited to, the California Fair Chance Act, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. For positions covered by federal and/or state banking regulations, American Express will comply with such regulations as it relates to the consideration of applicants with criminal convictions.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

US Job Seekers - Click to view the “ Know Your Rights ” poster. If the link does not work, you may access the poster by copying and pasting the following URL in a new browser window: https://www.eeoc.gov/poster

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
company_description: At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
THE POSITION
Our roster has an opening with your name on it

We are looking for an Analytics Engineer to join our Casino Analytics team. You will support the Casino business driving scalable analytics products (data assets, dashboards, visualizations, tools/services) and analytic frameworks. You will work alongside a group of analysts to facilitate the team's success, evolving the various tools, models, and data visualizations used to drive the FanDuel Group business. This is a tremendous opportunity to collaborate cross-functionally as well as develop the analytics team's data infrastructure and visualization capabilities.

In addition to the specific responsibilities outlined above, employees may be required to perform other such duties as assigned by the Company. This ensures operational flexibility and allows the Company to meet evolving business needs.


THE GAME PLAN
Everyone on our team has a part to play

  • Create interactive Tableau dashboards, custom visualizations and reports to visualize customer behavior, drivers of business performance, and support strategic decision making
  • Prioritize best practices in design, usability, and scalability to ensure sustainable and quality reporting
  • Communicate technical findings/insights to non-technical stakeholders to drive strategic success
  • Collaborate with data engineers and data scientists to ensure that data is accurately represented and enable richer analysis
  • Become a key business partner to the analytics team and stakeholders across the Casino business, supporting them in driving insights and key decision making
  • Opportunity to mentor junior analysts and engineers on day-to-day requests as well as team best practices

THE STATS
What we're looking for in our next teammate

  • 2+ years' experience in an analytics/technical role preferred
  • Bachelor's Degree in a highly numerate major (Math, Statistics, Economics, etc.) or relevant experience in data and/or business analysis preferred
  • Strong personal organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a lot of ambiguity
  • Proficiency in SQL, Excel and Tableau or another data visualization platforms required
  • Familiarity with programming languages (e.g. Python, R), cloud computing platforms (e.g. Databricks), or ELT/data modeling (e.g. DBT) highly desirable
  • Strong problem-solving skills, allied with track record of transforming data into actionable business insight
  • Experience working in groups and leading smaller intra year projects
  • Experience collaboratively working with colleagues in other countries and time zones preferred
  • Strong stakeholder management
  • Ability to be independent and lead on projects - proactive thinking
  • Interest in Fantasy Sports/Gaming/Sports a plus

ABOUT FANDUEL

FanDuel Group is the premier mobile gaming company in the United States and Canada. FanDuel Group consists of a portfolio of leading brands across mobile wagering including: America's #1 Sportsbook, FanDuel Sportsbook; its leading iGaming platform, FanDuel Casino; the industry's unquestioned leader in horse racing and advance-deposit wagering, FanDuel Racing; and its daily fantasy sports product.

In addition, FanDuel Group operates FanDuel TV, its broadly distributed linear cable television network and FanDuel TV+, its leading direct-to-consumer OTT platform. FanDuel Group has a presence across all 50 states, Canada, and Puerto Rico.

The company is based in New York with US offices in Los Angeles, Atlanta, and Jersey City, as well as global offices in Canada and Scotland. The company's affiliates have offices worldwide, including in Ireland, Portugal, Romania, and Australia.

FanDuel Group is a subsidiary of Flutter Entertainment, the world's largest sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: FLUT).


PLAYER BENEFITS
We treat our team right

We offer amazing benefits above and beyond the basics. We have an array of health plans to choose from (some as low as $0 per paycheck) that include programs for fertility and family planning, mental health support, and fitness benefits. We offer generous paid time off (PTO & sick leave), annual bonus and long-term incentive opportunities (based on performance), 401k with up to a 5% match, commuter benefits , pet insurance, and more - check out all our benefits here: FanDuel Total Rewards. *Benefits differ across location, role, and level.

FanDuel is an equal opportunities employer and we believe, as one of our principles states, "We are One Team!". As such, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, local or federal law. We believe FanDuel is strongest and best able to compete if all employees feel valued, respected, and included.


The applicable salary range for this position is $98,000 - $128,100 USD, which is dependent on a variety of factors including relevant experience, location, business needs and market demand. This role may offer the following benefits: medical, vision, and dental insurance; life insurance; disability insurance; a 401(k) matching program; among other employee benefits. This role may also be eligible for short-term or long-term incentive compensation, including, but not limited to, cash bonuses and stock program participation. This role includes paid personal time off and 14 paid company holidays. FanDuel offers paid sick time in accordance with all applicable state and federal laws.

FanDuel is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.
